page.title: 08AIRDRIE_AN OPEN AIR MARKET
page.content: IN 1695 MR. ROBERT HAMILTON,{LAIRD OF {AIRDRIE}APPLIED TO THE SCOTTISH PARLIAMENT REQUESTING AN ACT TO ALLOW AIRDRIE TO HOLD WEEKLY{"MERCATS" (MARKETS). NOWADAYS THERE ARE TWO - ON TUESDAYS AND FRIDAYS IN LOUDEN ST. CAR PARK. ALL TYPES OF GOODS ARE SOLD FROM FRUIT AND FISH TO ELECTRICAL GOODS AND CARPETS. THE OPEN-STALL HOLDERS COME FROM FAR AFIELD AS DO THE CUSTOMERS. PEOPLE HOLD DIVERSE VIEWS: "YOU DO NOT GET THE SAME COURTESY AS YOU DO FROM THE SHOP KEEPERS". "YOU ARE ALLOWED TO BARGAIN AND BRING THE PRICE DOWN". THE MORE AFFLUENT THINK THAT THE GOODS ARE OF INFERIOR QUALITY AND THAT THE AFTERMATH OF FLYING PAPERS AND DISCARDED PLASTIC BAGS MAKE THE MARKET UNDESIRABLE. SPOOK ERECTION, WHO ORGANISE IT, TRY TO DO A GOOD JOB.
